newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary O/N rates bottom out at 21 pct, down 0.5pct.
newsitem.headline: Hungary O/N rates bottom out at 21 pct, down 0.5pct.

text.p: Hungarian overnight rates dropped half a percentage point on Friday, but were likely to rebound after the long weekend, traders said.
Overnight rates bottomed out at 21 percent in abundant liquidity after dropping 1.5 percentage points on Thursday to 21.50 percent.
Domestic fundamentals were unlikely to cause an overnight rate increase on Tuesday, the next market day, but one trader said foreign orders could still drive rates up.
"There are always banks like CIB or Unicbank, who have orders from major foreign clients and this could drive rates up next week," said Sandor Tolonics of Commerzbank.
He said an about one percentage point rise was likely at the beginning of next week.
